content:
This chunk is part of a detailed guide explaining the configuration options within the Particle Panel in Panda3D, specifically focusing on Renderer settings. It describes how to customize various particle effects, including line renderers with head/tail colors and length adjustments, 3D geometry-based particles using egg files, point particles with size and color transitions, and sparkling particles with customizable radii and colors. The context includes parameters for scaling, animation, and color interpolation over time segments to enhance visual effects.

Context: This chunk is situated within the Renderer section of the Particle Panel documentation, detailing how to customize particle effects such as line, geometry, point, and sparkle renderers, including their color transitions, scales, and animations.

1.1 – 1.2) Head color and tail color of the line can be different.

1.3) You can set the lenght of the line here.

GeomParticleRender

GeomParticleRender renders particles as full 3D objects. This requires a geometry node. Just type the path to the egg file you want to use.

undocumented

2.2, 2.4, 2.6) Initial X/Y/Z scales. You can set the scales of particles here.

2.3, 2.5, 2.7) Final X/Y/Z scales. If the "X Scale","Y Scale" and "Z Scale" are enabled, then the the values between Initial X/Y/Z and Final X/Y/Z will be interpolated over particle's life.

Segments can be used to change the colour of particles during their lifetime.

PointParticleRender

Renders particles as pixel points.

3.1) Size of the points (1 pixel by default)

3.2 – 3.3) Starting and ending colors. The colors the points will have during their birth and death.

3.4) How the particles blend from the start color to the end color.

3.5) Interpolation method between colors.
